main event: On 21 October 1957, two slow-moving white objects were observed in Neptune, New Jersey, with characteristics resembling a satellite.
interesting points: The objects were approximately half the size of Sputnik and were reported to move from Southeast to East., The observer initially tracked the objects with binoculars and noted their blinking and oscillating motion., The sighting was made during the night under clear conditions with unlimited visibility., There were no known conventional aircraft or balloons observed in the area at the time of the sighting., The report concluded it might be a satellite, specifically Sputnik, which was verified further.
witness description: A.B. Hamilton, who described the objects as large and moving at high speed.
